devdoc.author: Moonstream Engineering (engineering@moonstream.to)
devdoc.details: This implementation adds a public and permissionless mint method to BindingERC721. It doesn't specify additional behavior, like tokenURI, etc. Subclass this if you want free mints.

ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,add.details: Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `operator`’s approval. Used in transfers.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC721InvalidOperator(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidOwner(address).details: Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in EIP-20. Used in balance queries.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.

ERC721InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256).details: Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

params._decimals: The number of decimal digits that make up the fractional part of token amounts in all TokenboundERC20 contracts created by this contract.
params._tbaImplementationAddress: The address of the ERC6551 account implementation for the tokenbound accounts created by this contract.
params._tbaRegistryAddress: The address of the ERC6551 registry that this contract uses to create tokenbound accounts.
params.name_: The name of the token collection represented by this ERC721 contract.
params.symbol_: A short identifier for the token collection represented by this ERC721 contract.

mint(address).details: This is not a "safe" mint - it does not check if a smart contract recipient implements onERC721Received.

returns._0: The token ID of the newly minted token.
returns._1: The address of the tokenbound account which has tokenbound ERC20 minting control.
returns._2: The address of the TokenboundERC20 contract.

mintTokenboundERC20(uint256,address,uint.details: This function atomically transfers the binding NFT to this contract, performs the tokenbound ERC20 mint, and then transfers the binding NFT back to its original owner.

devdoc.title: A permissionless implementation of an ERC721 contract designed to bind Tokenbound ERC20s

decimals().notice: The number of decimals that each TokenboundERC20 contract deployed by this contract will have.

mint(address).notice: This function allows any caller to mint a token on this contract to any address.

mintTokenboundERC20(uint256,address,uint.notice: This function allows the current owner of a token on this contract to mint on its tokenbound ERC20 contract without having to interact directly with the tokenbound account.

supply().notice: The number of ERC721 tokens minted by this contract.

tba(uint256).notice: A mapping which relates each token ID to the tokenbound account with minting authority on its TokenboundERC20 contract.

tbaImplementationAddress().notice: The address of the ERC6551 account implementation used to create tokenbound accounts.

tbaRegistryAddress().notice: The address of the ERC6551 registry used to create tokenbound accounts.

tberc20(uint256).notice: A mapping which relates each token ID to its TokenboundERC20 contract.

userdoc.notice: This contract is a BindingERC721 contract which allows anyone to mint ERC721 tokens with corresponding tokenbound ERC20 contracts.
